result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L Baley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Green Lake County Clerk of Court

supervisions.notes: To commence immediately and is to be consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fine and costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines and/or costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant is to abide by all rules of extended supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

of Sentencing Hearing held on October 31, 2017, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter

3:57 p.m.  Defendant in csutody and present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - entered a plea on 09/26 and today is the argued sentencing.  Statement by DA - confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Court has read the letters submitted to the court.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

18 months of Initial Confinement and 6 months of extended supervision.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Defendant is to abide by all rules of extended supervision.
-Court costs.

Court any money on file be applied to the costs and restituion.
Court orders any monies due to be converted to a civil judgment.

Sentence is to commence immediately and is to be consecutive to any other sentence.

Court finds the defendant not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Court grants the defendant 34 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 4:20 p.m.
from Atty Jon Wilsnack dated October 25, 2017 with letter from the defendant's mother
from Atty Jon Wilsnack dated October 18, 2017 with miscellaneous letter attached from Cindy Gernon
from Atty Jon Wilsnack dated October 2, 2017 re: defendant's health
Sentencing hearing on October 31, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

3:17 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - matter is resolved and requests a sentencing date.  Court recites offer, defendant will plea to count 2 as repeater and counts 1 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as charged and orders counts 1 & 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Court sets for Sentencing on October 31, 2017 at 3:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:24 p.m.
